website_summaries.verdict: The best portable solar generator on the market today, with an included solar panel that charges the compact battery quickly.
pros: Charges quickly with either included solar panel or AC adapter
Battery life is fairly reliable and lasts 8-plus hours for many users
cons: LED indicators can give inaccurate readings after charging using AC adapter (but not with solar panel)
Some issues with charging or with variable battery life
Rigid solar panel is a bit clunky to store
Beeping sound when battery power is low can’t be turned off

customer_reviews.title: Camping
customer_reviews.text: Well I made this purchase for camping to charge electronics and use an air pump to blow up an air mattress. It works fine for charging electronics but will not run an air pump. Called goal zero didn't really get any help from them tested both air pumps that I have only pulled 4 amps and 3 amps should have worked but didn't. So called amazon to resolve issue they went above and beyond to help me. So the two stars are for goal zero and would give five stars to amazon.
customer_reviews.author: mechtech

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product! I used it on a beach camping ...
customer_reviews.text: Holy cow! This is a great product! I used it on a beach camping trip. There was so much power that I didn't even need the solar panels for recharging. I camped for 4 days and charged my phone twice a day and still had 80% power!
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: This is a great starter battery
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter battery, but I quickly realized this doesn't have the power I needed when I needed it; so I now have the Yeti 400. Great products, but definitely consider going up one step to the Yeti 400 if you plan on charging more than a few cell phones.
customer_reviews.author: brad lorell flint

customer_reviews.title: Portable Power in the Field
customer_reviews.text: A highly responsive photovoltaic (The Nomad 20) and a built-in inverter with punch-in/punch-out circuit breakers (The Yeti 150) make this package a real gem for remote power generation. I used it to power a laptop computer and a clock drive for an astronomy rig. I never ran out of power. The only improvement I can see to this would be if, instead of a rigid photovoltaic, GoalZero added an option for either a rollshade unit. PowerFilm Solar now offers a foldable unit that ships with the Yeti 150, but their rollshade will stow more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon YorkTop Contributor: Astronomy

customer_reviews.title: Great for life on the road
customer_reviews.text: This thing has helped me out so many times! It's great for keeping my phone and other gadgets charged while traveling for long periods of time! It works pretty great, and I don't have any complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Laurent

customer_reviews.title: This kit is amazing and highly recommended for back up and all outdoor ...
customer_reviews.text: This kit is amazing and highly recommended for back up and all outdoor power. I can't say enough about it. Must have back up power!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Battery doesnt hold charge after a while. Secind battery same problem
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Savoy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Item for Festival Camping
customer_reviews.text: Used this device to provide light and charge my cell phone while camping at a music festival. Did a great job and still had ~80% battery left at the end of the 4 days.
customer_reviews.author: SocialMicrobe

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit
customer_reviews.text: Great unit with great capacity in a charge. You cannot hear its inverter running at all. It has a nice compact size and a very sturdy construction. Great that you can run the inverter and help the charge at the same time with the solar panels and very ez to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua meade

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: currently using it to charge my phones at night, as i have not yet been able to go camping. I plan to take the solar panel with me on my trip to Europe it's light, quiet also like the feature that you can turn off the output ports so not all of them are active all the time. Customer Service is GREAT, Notified me before original ship date that the product was going to be delayed due to upgrades on the device to make the battery last longer. Didn't mind the delay, because they actually took the time to contact me to let me know, and was very responsive and kept me informed of the progress.
customer_reviews.author: Jun Hee Kim

customer_reviews.title: Was never able to charge it with the solar panel.
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother with the solar panel. I tried for three straight days to charge my yeti150 and never did I get enough juice. I would sit the solar panel outside for 10+ hours and still it wouldn't make much of a difference. Should've purchased the bigger model.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Paredes

customer_reviews.title: I Shall See!
customer_reviews.text: I've try it one night on my CPAP without the use of the humidifier on, it lasted 8.5 hours. Now, the only thing I need to do is If I'm able to recharge Yeti 150 Solar Generator with Nomad 20 solar panel. Here in Alaska I'm going to have to wait until May/June 2015, by then we may have enough sunlight to recharge the generator. Come summer come!
customer_reviews.author: rudy

customer_reviews.title: it is fine.
customer_reviews.text: This kit works exactly "as advertised". 5V, 12V, and 120V output, and input is either from solar, or you can plug it into an AC outlet. It is too heavy for backpacking, of course - but for emergencies, or for other away-from-home needs, it is fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. Jeter

customer_reviews.title: generator takes a long time to charge and make high ...
customer_reviews.text: generator takes a long time to charge and make high pitch beeping sound when it starts to run out of power. No off switch for the beeping sound.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Unit can not hold charge. Now working with Goal Zero to reset battery.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Wienecke

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than expected so many uses with the ability to bring power with you
customer_reviews.author: stlouis025

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Stupid if you dont have this as a minimum if you live on earth
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Expedition Proven
customer_reviews.text: I love powering my technology with my Goal Zero Solar panels. I use the Rock Out Speaker to turn my laptop into a movie theatre on expedition & for music at basecamp. We also recharge our cell phones & Garmin GPS/Heart rate monitors which is helpful at altitude. Goal Zero Rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coyne

product_meta.title: Goal Zero Yeti 150 Portable Power Station, 150Wh Small Generator Alternative with 12V, AC and USB Outputs
product_meta.description:
Size:Yeti 150

Goal Zero Yeti 150 Portable Power Station: A small, 168 watt-hour power bank for charging phones, tablets, small laptops, and other personal electronics devices. 

Power for Phones, Tablets, Small Laptops, and More: Up to 15 recharges on most phones, like iPhone and Android through the 2.1A USB port. Get 1 to 2 recharges on small laptops and up to 8 recharges on most DSLR camera batteries. Compatible with iPhone, Samsung, Dell laptops, and others. Not designed for charging Apple MacBook. 

Gasoline-free Generator Alternative: The Goal Zero Yeti 150 stores energy in a rechargeable, 12V lead-acid battery and operates without fumes or noise for safe, silent, clean way to power up your devices anywhere. 

Recharge at Home, in the Car, or Anywhere: Easily recharge from an AC outlet in about 6 hours, from a 12V outlet* in about 8 hours, or from a solar panel in up to 3 hours depending on solar conditions and the size of the solar panel*. Charge it and use it all at once with pass-through charging. 

Unparalleled Power Station Expertise: We’ve been powering people all over the world, from the Congo to Antarctica, Alaska to Florida. Our expertise goes beyond just USB, we understand what it takes to make rugged, dependable power stations with a variety of sophisticated outputs that will work when and where you need them. 

US Based Solutions Center Team: Our friendly customer service team is located onsite in at our headquarters in Utah. These power experts are knowledgeable and easy to reach by phone, email, or online chat. 

*12V Car Charger and solar panels sold separately
feature_bullets: 168Wh lead acid battery portable power station can power up to 5 devices at once (14Ah @12V)
Continuous 80W, 160W surge modified-sine wave inverter, 2.1A USB ports, 120W 12V ports
Charge phones, tablets, cameras, tablets, and other small devices
Recharges from AC, 12V or solar panels (sold separately)
Designed and engineered by power station experts with a US-based customer service center

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars396 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
